Description: Cypriot pottery juglet in Black-on-Red ware; spherical body with narrow disc-base; tall neck flaring to a funnel-shaped mouth; neck-ridge half way up the height of the neck; handle from shoulder to neck-ridge; red clay and lustrous brownish red slip, decorated with black paint: small swastika on front part of shoulder with group of narrow bands below; broader bands around the neck; ladder pattern on the handle.
Curator's comments: Compare V. Karageorghis, Palaepaphos-Skales: an Iron Age Cemetery in Cyprus (Kostanz 1983), Tomb 56, no. 1.
